code: @Manual{,   title = {pkghw4ge: Package - Homework 4 - Programming Tools in Data Science},   author = {Jacopo Beghetto and Alistair Bisol and Andrea Ferrazzo and Manoel Pidoux},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: Bootstrap Function Modification — Bootstrap
text: Bootstrap function provide always object class bootstrap.

title: Bootstrap Function Modification — Bootstrap
text: x represent original sample B number bootstrap samples. default B = 1000 statistic indicator statistic applied samples sample_size length every bootstrap sample. default sample_size = "original sample size"

title: Bootstrap Function Modification — Bootstrap
text: list type bootstrap.class composed relevant values provided Bootstrap function: theta_hat statistic applied original sample theta_star list length B composed statistics applied bootstrapped samples varBoot variance applied theta_star Unbiased_estimator Unbieased variance estimator coerced_to_a_vector Returning True Flase regarding initial sample coerced vector stat Return name statistic used thruough Bootstrap function B Number bootrsapped samples sample_size Return length every bootstrap sample

title: Bootstrap Function Modification — Bootstrap
text: Group-E

title: Bootstrap Function Modification — Bootstrap
code: Bootstrap(rnorm(100), statistic = mean) #> Non-parametric bootstrap estimate of the variance of 'mean' #> ----------------- #> Variance estimate is 0.0101  #> Based on B=1000 bootstrap replicates #> and a sample of size: 100

title: Plot Bootstrap — plot.bootstrap
text: method original plot function made bootstrap class. return box-plot.

title: Plot Bootstrap — plot.bootstrap
code: # S3 method for bootstrap plot(x, main, pch, cex, horizontal, ...)

title: Plot Bootstrap — plot.bootstrap
text: x output-list returned Bootstrap function main represent title final plot. default "Bootstrap estimates" pch shape outliers dots.  default 19 cex size outliers dots. default 1 horizontal orientation box-plot. default F ... parameters 'plot.bootstrap' function

title: Plot Bootstrap — plot.bootstrap
text: boxplot bootstrap estimates.

title: Plot Bootstrap — plot.bootstrap
text: Group-E

title: Plot Bootstrap — plot.bootstrap
code: boot <- Bootstrap(rnorm(100), statistic = var) plot(boot, main = "Test", cex = 2, horizontal = TRUE)

title: Bootstrap Print Modification — print.bootstrap
text: print.bootstrap function method basic print function. function print information regarding bootstrap class generated Bootstrap function.

title: Bootstrap Print Modification — print.bootstrap
text: x output-list returned Bootstrap function. ... parameters 'prnt.bootstrap' function

title: Bootstrap Print Modification — print.bootstrap
text: print relevant information provided Bootstrap function.

title: Bootstrap Print Modification — print.bootstrap
text: Group-E

title: Bootstrap Print Modification — print.bootstrap
code: boot2 <- Bootstrap(matrix(rnorm(200), nc = 2), statistic = var) #> Warning: 'x' has been coerced to a vector print(boot2) #> Non-parametric bootstrap for 'var' #> ----------------- #> Variance estimate is 0.0149  #> Based on B=1000 bootstrap replicates #> and a sample of size: 200

title: Print Summary Bootstrap — print.summary.bootstrap
text: print.summary.bootstrap function method basic print function. print summary regarding summary.bootstrap class generated summary.bootstrap function.

title: Print Summary Bootstrap — print.summary.bootstrap
code: # S3 method for summary.bootstrap print(x, digits, ...)

title: Print Summary Bootstrap — print.summary.bootstrap
text: x output-list returned summary.bootstrap function digits decimals points desired printed output. default digits = 2 ... parameters 'print.summary.bootstrap' function

title: Print Summary Bootstrap — print.summary.bootstrap
text: print main summary information Bootstrap function modified digits arguments. print complementary first print summary.bootstrap function.

title: Print Summary Bootstrap — print.summary.bootstrap
text: Group-E

title: Print Summary Bootstrap — print.summary.bootstrap
code: boot <- Bootstrap(rnorm(100), statistic = var) print(summary(boot), digits = 5) #> Non-parametric bootstrap for 'var' #> Number of bootstrap replicates: 1000  #>  #> Statistic on the sample 'x': var(x)=1.03 #>  #> Confidence interval at the 95%-level: #> 0.75 1.32  #>  #> Bootstrap estimates: #>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max.  #>    0.64    0.92    1.01    1.02    1.12    1.61  #>  #>  #>  #>  -----------------  #>  #> With application of 5 decimal places #>  #> Non-parametric bootstrap for 'var' #> Number of bootstrap replicates: 1000  #>  #> Statistic on the sample 'x': var(x)=1.03144 #>  #> Confidence interval at the 95%-level: #> 0.74558 1.31729  #>  #> Bootstrap estimates: #>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max.  #> 0.63585 0.92283 1.01262 1.02157 1.11664 1.60560  #>

title: Summary Bootstrap — summary.bootstrap
text: summary.bootstrap function method basic summary function. print summary regarding bootstrap class generated Bootstrap function. returned values class summary.bootstrap.

title: Summary Bootstrap — summary.bootstrap
code: # S3 method for bootstrap summary(x, level, digits, ...)

title: Summary Bootstrap — summary.bootstrap
text: x output-list returned Bootstrap function level represent confidence level 1-alpha. default level = 0.95 digits decimals points desired printed output. default digits = 2 ... parameters 'summary.bootstrap' function

title: Summary Bootstrap — summary.bootstrap
text: print main summary information Bootstrap function. also return list composed follow: summary return list composed basic summary function output applied theta_star output CI return list lower upper limit confidence interval sto theta_hat Bootstrap function coerced_to_a_vector Returning True Flase regarding initial sample coerced vector usage Bootstrap function level Represent confidence level 1-alpha called parameter stat Return name statistic used thruough Bootstrap function B Number bootrsapped samples thourgh Bootstrap function

title: Summary Bootstrap — summary.bootstrap
text: Group-E

title: Summary Bootstrap — summary.bootstrap
code: boot <- Bootstrap(rnorm(100), statistic = var) summary(boot, level = 0.90) #> Non-parametric bootstrap for 'var' #> Number of bootstrap replicates: 1000  #>  #> Statistic on the sample 'x': var(x)=0.95 #>  #> Confidence interval at the 90%-level: #> 0.74 1.17  #>  #> Bootstrap estimates: #>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max.  #>    0.60    0.86    0.94    0.95    1.03    1.52
